node.title: Geochemistry module question
node.bodyText:
Dear MOOSE team,
we are  learning to apply the geochemistry module with the self-developed application to run 1D calcite dissolution with acidic injected water (pH=4).  I have two questions about applying the module and am grateful for any input or suggestion:


The example is on the developing stage, but I faced the issue with being able to run the simulations with the version  of geochemistry module of 30.04 and  not being able to run it with the version of 30.07.


While running the simulations, I receive negative concentrations on the first time steps which obviously should not happen.


Would you have any idea what could be the reason for both of these issues?
I am providing below the geochemistry input file:

chem_THC1D.txt
Thanks a lot and a great day,
Elena
@WilkAndy @rpodgorney

Dear @WilkAndy @rpodgorney, dear @GiudGiud ,
I have been trying to resolve the abovementioned issue with negative concentrations of H+ with unfortunately no success, and I would highly appreciate any advice on how to proceed with it. In addition, I noticed reported negative concentration in one of examples given in MOOSE-Geochemistry simulations: table 9 in:
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/modules/geochemistry/tests_and_examples/geotes_weber_tensleep.html#table:model_bulk
Concentrations of H+ and O2(aq) are negative. Could you please provide some comment on that?
Many thanks and have a great day,
Elena

Hello
Did you try the Bounds system? That forces variables to stay within a range
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/auxkernels/ConstantBoundsAux.html

upd. Not sure if I need to make another post, but when I do the Multiapp copy tranfer with the transport, the geochemistry module simulation overwrites the boundary condition in the transport (Dirichlet BC with the constant concentrations)

that s normal. Transfers can overwrite inital conditions for a variable.
If you dont want that, transfer with an execute_on of TIMESTEP_END
Thank you! The fact is, we are using the Dirichlet boundary condition with the fixed concentration, and the fixed concentration is overwritten.
preset option is on and we do the TIMESTEP_END transfer
can you apply the DirichletBC in the app that provides the data for the transfer too?

we use Geochemistry module of MOOSE to update the reactions and send it to the transport simulation. The BC is set in the transport app, while it cannot be set up in the Geochemistry module. The problem is, the BC for the solute transport in the transport app are overwritten by Geochemistry.
update: we set up transfer to  Geochemistry TIMESTEP_BEGINNING and it seems to work. The issues above keep being a problem.

Have you tried to run a batch simulation with just Geochemistry module?  It may be easier to figure out the problem. One issue I find with your constraint is that you don't actually  have a fixed pH=4 in your setup. If you have a fixed pH for your chemical reaction, you should reflect it using constraint_species and constraint_value, usually is the log10activity  of H+

node.title: Changing subdomains based on element types
node.bodyText:
Hi all,
Does MOOSE have the capability to read a mesh and reassign the subdomains for elements of a specified type?
For example, I have a mesh of HEX8's and TET4's on subdomain 1. I want to create a new subdomain, remove the HEX8's from subdomain 1, and move them onto the new subdomain.
Then, as an aside, if anyone knows how to perform this in GMSH, advice there would be welcome as well.
Thank you!

Yes
please use the meshrepairgenerator with the separate element type parameter
you ll have to use this Generator after loading the mesh
This is a fairly new capability you will need moose to be up to date for this
Just updated and tested it. It works great! Thank you for the response

node.title: Offline installation of Moose compilation error
node.bodyText:
I install moose on a computer without an internet connection and successfully compile petsc and libmesh(https://mooseframework.inl.gov/getting_started/installation/offline_installation.html). But I meet an error when I compile moose. What caused this error and how can I fix it. @hugary1995
output.txt
This looks to me like a mismatch between your MOOSE version and your libMesh/TIMPI version. Did you recursively update submodules?

I meet the same error as https://github.com/idaholab/moose/discussions/21342?sort=top. So I install libtirpc-1.1.4-5.el8.x86_64 and libtirpc-devel-1.1.4-5.el8.x86_64 before compile libmesh. In addition, I install mpich-3.4.2 due to my computer's system is RHEL8.4 without mpich. Is it because of the problem with their version？

Alex is talking about MOOSE and libmesh versions.

How did you obtain both codes to install offline?
Can you give us the current commit for moose and libmesh? cd into each folder and type git log HEAD

Also will need to know the TIMPI hash. You can run
git submodule status —recursive

I want to use the program developed on the updated moose in July 2022, so I downloaded the latest version of moose first.
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/getting_started/installation/offline_installation.html
git clone https://github.com/idaholab/moose.git cd moose git checkout master git submodule update --init git submodule foreach --recursive git submodule update --init
Then I use the following command for version rollback.
git reset --hard ccf25ce
Finally I install moose  on a computer without an internet connection. The following are the results I obtaine using the command.


moose:
commit ccf25ce (HEAD -> master)
Merge: 27d8863 3bb5876
Author: moosetest bounces@inl.gov
Date:   Wed Jul 13 22:46:33 2022 -0600
Merge commit '3bb5876c5c3f29649f426ff5535f8a3007658acb'


libmesh:
commit fd900b54a02b9d1b99f0a4371d4acb4761e57b0f (HEAD)
Merge: c965dd619 9341cc9bc
Author: Roy H. Stogner Roy.Stogner@inl.gov
Date:   Tue Jul 25 08:06:06 2023 -0500
Merge pull request #3604 from roystgnr/l2_hierarchic_prism
Hierarchic (and L2_HIERARCHIC) FE prism support


git submodule status:
[liu@localhost moose_22.7]$ git submodule status
+08357135db54e430770ee8433f5e6e9735e2c931 large_media (remotes/origin/phase_field_old_wiki-128-g0835713)
+fd900b54a02b9d1b99f0a4371d4acb4761e57b0f libmesh (cpp03_final-8761-gfd900b54a)
f855b95493736b087b8ccc16dc6c5b29bc4b5aa8 petsc (v3.16.5-15-gf855b954937)

Well no you can't do that.
You reset MOOSE to this old version, you did not reset libmesh or timpi.
We do not advise you do that at all.
Please use the latest moose version and update your application to make it work with this latest MOOSE. This is the path of least effort and of least bugs!

Yea the rolled back moose is not going to work with the new submodule hashes. If you really want to use that moose version you should run the git submodule update command after checking out the old moose

So I should use the follow command to aligne the version of moose and libmesh .
cd ~/projects
git clone https://github.com/idaholab/moose.git
cd moose
git reset --hard ccf25ce
git checkout master
git submodule update --init
git submodule foreach --recursive git submodule update --init


moose
commit ccf25ce (HEAD -> master, next)
Merge: 27d8863 3bb5876
Author: moosetest bounces@inl.gov
Date:   Wed Jul 13 22:46:33 2022 -0600
Merge commit '3bb5876c5c3f29649f426ff5535f8a3007658acb'


libmesh
commit 4747096de5d6c69ed79f28e38ce45c76546364c3 (HEAD)
Merge: b50932009 fd6ba0e0a
Author: Roy H. Stogner Roy.Stogner@inl.gov
Date:   Fri Jun 3 13:23:45 2022 -0500
Merge pull request #3311 from roystgnr/matrix_dual_decl
Use declarations header for declarations


git submodule status:
e1211aaf2dec766e9a8e2da1631ee2f36ec7c5de large_media (remotes/origin/phase_field_old_wiki-67-ge1211aa)
4747096de5d6c69ed79f28e38ce45c76546364c3 libmesh (cpp03_final-7575-g4747096de)
f855b95493736b087b8ccc16dc6c5b29bc4b5aa8 petsc (v3.16.5-15-gf855b954937)


Now their versions seem to match, I will try to install again.

node.title: aspect ratio distribution of 2d grains
node.bodyText:
Hello. Does MOOSE have the function to calculate aspect ratio distribution of 2d grains?
In the phase-field simulation, we can get a final grain structure. Then we focus on the geometric properties of grains that are related to ellipses fitted to the grains and calculate aspect ratio distribution like the pictures.
@dschwen

node.title: Failing CIVET test under "Build unit test"
node.bodyText:
I'm working on a PR to remove various deprecated code in Moltres. After replacing ModulesApp::registerAll with ModulesApp::registerAllObjects<MoltresApp> and other associated changes, the CI test for the PR fails at the "Build unit test" stage. Here's the link to the Civet test results: https://civet.inl.gov/job/1749366/
It seems to be related to the Reactor module. Do I need to make additional changes to accommodate compiling reactor with Moltres?

Hello
Nothing comes to mind rn. @permcody were there specific changes for unit tests to do?
Guillaume

The easy fix is to make sure the set of modules for your Unit Makefile
exactly matches your main application Makefile.
…
On Tue, Sep 5, 2023 at 10:58 PM Guillaume Giudicelli < ***@***.***> wrote:
 Hello

 Nothing comes to mind rn. @permcody <https://github.com/permcody> were
 there specific changes for unit tests to do?

 Guillaume

 —
 Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
 <#25406 (comment)>,
 or unsubscribe
 <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAXFOIBSDVREPGNMMD26Z73XY77IHANCNFSM6AAAAAA4MM2TMA>
 .
 You are receiving this because you were mentioned.Message ID:
 ***@***.***>
This fixed the issue. Thank you!

node.title: FV vs FE memory consumption
node.bodyText:
Hi,
I am testing my  FV version of the Ferret app and it seems like it consumes a LOT more memory than the FE version. Is this generally the case (or is there perhaps something goofy with my FV implementation)?
One thing you can try is setting cache_cell_gradients = false in your variable blocks
Thanks, Alex. I'll give it a shot.

node.title: Keep Block Array Data - Mesh Operations With --mesh-only
node.bodyText:
Hi there :)
I'm running some mesh manipulations (eg refinement) on an exodus file containing material parametrization as block arrays. I'm doing that with an input file containing only the mesh block together with --mesh-only.
I prefer to do the mesh stuff in a separate step and would still like to be able use the block array information in the subsquent simulations (input files that only use FileMeshGenerator, loading the manipulated and checked mesh file).
Is there a way to keep element data when using --mesh-only? I tried use_for_exodus_restart = true with my FileMeshGenerator without any effect.
Cheers
Florian

Hello
Yes in the filemeshgenerator you use this parameter:
exodus_extra_element_integers
to keep the element integers that are already defined on the mesh
Guillaume
Awesome, works! I totally overlooked this.  Thank you!

oh I just noticed that this is only working with integers as the name of the parameter suggests. My material values eg are rock permeability which are floats like 1e-14 and this gets rounded to zero. Any way to preserve these values?

Hello
Yes! That s a different thing. In your file_mesh_generator add use_for_exodus_restart then in your auxvariables, you specify the initial_from_file_var field.
You can also specify the step
Guillaume
this is possible while using --mesh-only flag?
nope
alright thanks! :)

node.title: August 2023 MOOSE Newsletter
node.bodyText:
The August 2023 MOOSE Newsletter has been released! A summary of the content is below:

MOOSE Improvements

Fin heat transfer enhancement functor materials added
Generating images on-the-fly in MooseDocs
Functor Neumann boundary condition
Cylindrical gap heat flux functor material
Nearest-point layered side averages for functors
Post-processors can now be used in functor parameters
Component to apply heat flux from an external application
Parsed functor material
Time interval times
Mesh repairs during the mesh generation/loading phase


Bug Fixes and Minor Enhancements

node.title: Error on make after update
node.bodyText:
I performed a mamba update all and updates to moose last night. Upon attempting to perform make of the modules, I am getting the following error:
fatal error: DistributedForce.h: No such file or directory
What is the possible solutions to avoid this error?
Without knowing what mamba packages you updated to, you may have run into the following (just a guess): #25358

The potential solution as presented did not fix the issue. Here is a more detail to the error:
/home/twise/projects/moose/modules/navier_stokes/src/kernels/DistributedPower.C:10:10: fatal error: DistributedPower.h: No such file or directory
10 | #include "DistributedPower.h"
|          ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
compilation terminated.
make: *** [/home/twise/projects/moose/framework/build.mk:144: /home/twise/projects/moose/modules/navier_stokes/build/unity_src/kernels_Unity.x86_64-conda-linux-gnu.opt.lo] Error 1
make: *** Waiting for unfinished jobs....

Hello
This looks odd. Does the file exist? Look in navier_stokes/include/kernels for DistributedPower.h (your current error) and DistributedForce.h (the first one you pasted)
Did the clone of the moose repo go well? What does git diff and git status return ?

The DistributedForce.h  file does not exit, however there is a file DistributedForce.C. I'll check the git diff and git status as soon as I have  an opportunity. Thanks.

Get Outlook for iOS<https://aka.ms/o0ukef>
…
________________________________
From: Guillaume Giudicelli ***@***.***>
Sent: Monday, September 4, 2023 10:02:28 PM
To: idaholab/moose ***@***.***>
Cc: Wise, Tammy ***@***.***>; Author ***@***.***>
Subject: Re: [idaholab/moose] Error on make after update (Discussion #25384)


Hello

This looks odd. Does the file exist? Look in navier_stokes/include/kernels for DistributedPower.h (your current error) and DistributedForce.h (the first one you pasted)

Did the clone of the moose repo go well? What does git diff and git status return ?

—
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub<#25384 (reply in thread)>, or unsubscribe<https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AJQ6AYW6YF77XXWFHHOUDADXY2B3JANCNFSM6AAAAAA4H65WSU>.
You are receiving this because you authored the thread.Message ID: ***@***.***>
I think the clone must have failed to download it. It s in the repo, I checked
either that or a gremlin deleted it from your folder
It appears during the update --all process most of the .h files in this directory were deleted: modules/navier_stokes/include/kernels/

If we're talking about mamba update --all, that process does not have the ability to delete files anywhere other than in $CONDA_PREFIX.
But also, mamba update --all is not the correct solution for this round of updates. Please visit the sticky post for more details on how to properly 'update' to the latest moose packages: #25358

when I run the "make" command, I get the following message: /home/twise/projects/moose/framework/app.mk:209: warning: ignoring old recipe for target '/home/twise/projects/moose/modules/navier_stokes/build/header_symlinks/DistributedForce.h'
make clobberall will help for that

I used the clobberall, that appears to have got MOOSE functional again. With all that I have attempted to try, all of my previous folders and work in the module folders is no longer there. Luckily I have some backups on a separate disk to retrieve some of my work.

I'm sorry to hear about this inconvenience.
make clobberall is fairly safe with regards to deletions iirc. git clean -xfd is a lot more dangerous in that regard

node.title: Decreasing the growth rate of dendrites using DiscreteNucleation material property
node.bodyText:
Hello
I have a phase field model depicting electro deposition in a non-uniform way as shown in figure (attached). However, I am trying to stop the growth at the spikes by manipulating the phase-field variable mu (grand potential PFM). I am using DiscreteNucleation material property to increase the magnitude of mu at the interface of the spike so that the growth takes place only at the flat area rather than the spike. This should result in a overall much smoother/flatter profile.
However, I am not able to achieve this using DiscreteNucleation material property which is trying to force mu to -20. A high (-ve) value of mu should result in lower concentration at the peak causing lower growth rate at spike as compared to the flatter region.
Thanks
@dschwen @laagesen @GiudGiud

Hi, I'm not sure why you're trying to stop the growth at the spikes. It seems like if this a natural feature that emerges from the physics of the model, you should not try to artificially suppress it. Dendrite formation can certainly happen in electrodeposition. Can you explain why you are trying to suppress growth?

Yes, I am trying to model the effect of additives which will preferentially
be adsorbed at the spikes because of higher electric field near them.
Further, these additives will repel the metal ion and lowering their concentration near the
spike interface leading to suppressed growth.

I am referring to this article
https://doi.org/10.1021/ja312241y

![Screenshot_20230902-070723-620.png](https://github.com/idaholab/moose/assets/69255835/c9d5e69b-1d46-45d1-82bd-9441512723fb)

I am not an expert in this area, but I don't think nucleation is the right way to go about suppressing growth here. This is a pretty complicated physical problem. Off the top of my head it seems that you would need to add a coupled electric field and solve Poisson's equation to understand the effect of additive concentration on electric field, and then the resulting field would be what is responsible for pushing the metal ions away. I'd suggest to do some literature search to find an existing phase-field model for this problem and we can try to help you implement that once you find it.
OK. Thanks for the help. I will certainly get back to you.
